utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Morning, Sheldon. Come dance with me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, while I subscribe to the many worlds theory which posits the existence of an infinite number of Sheldons in an infinite number of universes, I assure you that in none of them am I dancing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you fun in any of them?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The math would suggest that in a few I’m a clown made of candy. But I don’t dance.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, want some French toast?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s Oatmeal Day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Tell you what, next French Toast Day, I will make you oatmeal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dear Lord, are you still going to be here on French Toast Day?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look, Leonard, Penny made French toast.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry. I haven’t given her your schedule yet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s an iCal download, she can put it right in her phone. And I thought we agreed that you’d have your conjugal visits in her apartment.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We did, but there were extenuating circumstances.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I see. Did her abysmal housekeeping skills finally trump her perkiness?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, her bed kind of… broke.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That doesn’t seem likely. Her bed’s of sturdy construction. Even the addition

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: A homunculus?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Perfectly formed miniature human being.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you’re my little homunculus.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry. Okay, who wants syrup and who wants cinnamon sugar?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want oatmeal.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, well, I want a boyfriend whose roommate isn’t a giant pain in the ass.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sure that will happen soon enough. But in the meantime, I still want oatmeal.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what, I give up. He’s impossible.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t be impossible. I exist. I believe what you meant to say is, “I give up, he’s improbable.”

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, you really need to find a better way of dealing with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What am I supposed to do, eat French toast on a Monday? Now, that would be impossible.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m just saying, you can catch more flies with honey than with vinegar.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You can catch even more flies with manure. What’s your point?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s a…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Boy, that does smell good. Too bad it’s Monday.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, so Kim the night manager went on maternity leave, and her husband’s name is Sandy, right? So get this, her replacement is a woman named Sandy whose husband’s name is Kim.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know. What are the odds?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Easily calculable, we begin by identifying the set of married couples with unisex names. We then eliminate those unqualified for restaurant work, the aged, the imprisoned and the limbless, for example. Next we look at…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon! it’s an amazing coincidence, can we leave it at that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Ooh, Penny, it’s as if the Cheesecake Factory is run by witches.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, Sheldon, it’s as if you don’t think I’ll punch you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, you guys, let it go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine, whatever. Are you finished?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, thank you. How thoughtful. Would you like a chocolate

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, yeah, sure, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You said be nice to Penny. I believe offering chocolate to someone falls within the definition of nice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It does. But in my experience, you don’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio, than are dreamt of in your philosophy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, now that’s you, obnoxious and insufferable.

utterance.speaker: Howard (arriving, in goth gear)
utterance.content: What’s going on, day dwellers?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, man, did the Kiss Army repeal don’t ask, don’t tell?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. Raj and I are going a goth club in Hollywood to hang with the night people. Anybody want to come along?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, wow, you’re actually going out like that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, no. I’m going out like this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, what did you do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They’re called tattoo sleeves. Look. I bought them online, Raj got a set, too. Fantastic, right? Put them on, have hot sex with some freaky girl with her business pierced, take them off, and I can still be buried in a Jewish cemetery.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, I’ve always wanted to go to a goth nighclub.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bazinga! None of you ever see my practical jokes coming, do you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, how about you two? Look, I’ve got some extra tat sleeves.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why are you carrying extras?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, In case I snag one on someone’s nipple ring.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I think we’ll pass.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, is the missus speaking for the couple now?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: In this case, you bet she is.

utterance.speaker: Howard (after Raj whispers)
utterance.content: Yes, she’s pushy and yes, he’s whipped, but that’s not the expression. Come on, I want to stop at Walgreens and pick up some more eyeliner.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They’re gonna get beaten up at that club.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: They’re gonna get beaten up at Walgreens. Oh, sorry, Sheldon, I almost sat in your spot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you? I didn’t notice. Have a chocolate.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think we’re fitting in quite nicely.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’d help if you weren’t drinking light beer.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, what’s so gothic about vodka and cranberry juice?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hello, it looks like blood. Did you even read the Wiki How link I sent you on being goth?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, I’m behind on my wiki-reading I’m kind of on a John Grisham kick right now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I finished reading The Pelican Brief and loved it so much, I dived right into The Client. He was a lawyer himself so his novels are accurate as well as entertaining.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just remember we are lost boys, children of the night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Great. Lost boys, children of the night. Got it. Can you pass the Chex mix, please. Thank you. We are lost boys.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m actually much morelost than he is.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Nice ink.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks. Can we buy you ladies a drink?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Two light beers.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Light beers? Well, Wiki-how about that?

utterance.speaker: Second girl
utterance.content: What’s your names?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m Howard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Raj.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: I’m Bethany.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nice to meet you, Bethany.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, very nice.

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: Nice to meet you too.

utterance.speaker: Second girl
utterance.content: I’m Sarah. Not that anyone cares.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do either of you ladies enjoy the novels of John Grisham?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s this cartoon called again?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oshikuru: Demon Samurai.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And it’s not a cartoon, it’s anime.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Anime. You know, I knew a girl in high school named Anna May. Anna May Fletcher. She was born with one nostril. Then she had this bad nose job and basically wound up with three.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re here a lot now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, am I talking too much? I’m sorry. Zip.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Chocolate?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes please. Oh. Hey, Kim. Yeah, I… You know what, hold on, let me take this in the hall. You’ll never guess who they got to replace you at work…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I know what you’re doing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, you’re using chocolates as positive reinforcement for what you consider correct behaviour.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very good. Chocolate?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I don’t want any chocolate! Sheldon, you can’t train my girlfriend like a lab rat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, it turns out I can.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you shouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s just no pleasing you, is there, Leonard? You weren’t happy with my previous approach to dealing with her, so I decided to employ operant conditioning techniques, building on the work of Thorndike and B.F. Skinner. By this time next week, I believe I can have her jumping out of a pool, balancing a beach ball on her nose.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, this has to stop now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not suggesting we really make her jump out of a pool. I thought the “bazinga” was implied. I’m just tweaking her personality, sanding off the rough edges if you will.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, you’re not sanding Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you saying that I’m forbidden from applying a harmless, scientifically valid protocol that will make our lives better?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, you’re forbidden.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (Squirting him with a water spray)
utterance.content: Bad Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: So what do you guys do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, you know, goth stuff. Goth magazines, goth music.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Goth food.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: What’s goth food?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh… blackened salmon?

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: No, I meant what do you do for jobs?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, we’re scientists.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, you know, the dark sciences.

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: What are the dark sciences

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I am an astrophysicist and a lot of that takes place at night. When there are vampires and miscellaneous undead out and about.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oy vay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That sounds really cool.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Does it? Okay, if you like space stuff, I design components for the international space station. Which is in space. Where, as I’m sure you know, no one can hear you scream.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So what do you gals do?

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: I work at the Gap.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really? How about that? I’ve been to the Gap.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve been there as well. I like your tee-shirts with the little pocket.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: I work there too. Not that anyone cares. You know, this place is boring.

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: Yeah. Why don’t we go somewhere else and have some fun?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sure, we like fun.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We are fun people.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dark and fun.

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: Come on, I know a place you’ll really dig.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did you bring the black condoms?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: In my fanny pack.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you happy now?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not particularly.

utterance.speaker: Penny (voice outside door)
utterance.content: Oh’ my God, she didn’t!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What could she possibly be talking about for so long?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Obviously, waitressing at the Cheesecake Factory is a complex socioeconomic activity, that requires a great deal of analysis and planning. Bazinga! You know, using positive reinforcement techniques, I could train that behaviour out of her in a week.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If you let me use negative reinforcement, I can get it done before we go to bed.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re not squirting her in the face with water.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, of course not. We’re talking very mild electric shocks. No tissue damage whatsoever.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Forget it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, come on, you can’t tell me that you’re not intrigued about the possibility of building a better girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not. And Penny’s qualities, both good and bad, are what make her who she is.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You mean, like that high-pitched, irritating laugh?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re not changing how Penny laughs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, that would be incongruous, I was going to lower the whole voice to a more pleasing register.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Uh, sorry guys, that girl is freaky!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Come again?

utterance.speaker: Penny (normal voice)
utterance.content: Freaky.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (lower voice)
utterance.content: Freaky?

utterance.speaker: Penny (lower voice)
utterance.content: Yeah, freaky.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Have a chocolate.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you seriously going to deface your body just for the possibility you could have cheap sex with a strange girl you met in a bar?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What is your mother going to say?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She’s not going to see it. She takes my temperature orally now.

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: What are you going to get, Howard?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I can’t really decide between a screaming devil, this mean little skull or Kermit the Frog.

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: Kermit the Frog?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know Hi ho, I’m on Howard’s butt!

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: Get the mean little skull, and I’ll see if I can make him smile.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I’d like the mean little skull, please.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: What are you going to get, Raj?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: With my luck, hepatitis

utterance.speaker: Tattooist
utterance.content: Okay, here we go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow!

utterance.speaker: Tattooist
utterance.content: That’s just rubbing alcohol.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know, but it was cold. Ow, ow, ow!

utterance.speaker: Tattooist
utterance.content: I’m putting on the stencil.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What comes after the stencil?

utterance.speaker: Tattooist
utterance.content: This.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Aaaaaargh! Okay, that’s it, no needle, no pain, no tattoo.

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: What’s the big deal, you’ve done this before.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, I haven’t, look. I’m sorry, I’m a fraud, he’s a fraud.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We’re both frauds.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I think I covered that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But I was summing up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re not goth, we’re just guys.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Very, very smart guys.

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: So you were totally scamming us?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes. And I wouldn’t blame you if you walked out of here and never wanted to see us again. Unless of course our bold honesty has suddenly made us attractive.

utterance.speaker: Bethany
utterance.content: I’m leaving.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: I’m leaving too. Not that anyone cares.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: When we tell this story, let’s end it differently.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you thinking? Maybe a big musical number?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m going to make some warm milk and then turn in. I trust if you two are planning in engaging in amorous activites, you’ll keep the decibel level to a minimum.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mmm, these are so good

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was just thinking, we should probably turn in too.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: well, my new bed got delivered, if you come over and put it together, you can stay at my place.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really, that’s a lot of work, and it’s kind of late.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, but if we stay there, we won’t have to be quiet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. Sex works even better than chocolate to modify behaviour. I wonder if anyone else has stumbled on to that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, wait, how about this? We say there were four goth girls, the two girls in the club had two friends.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I like it, I like it. Did they smell good despite their gothlike nature?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s that got to do with the story?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Engaging my olfactory sense helps make it real for me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine, they smelled good.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, they did. Like jasmine and honeysuckle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Whatever.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And then they held hands and did a sexy, demonic hokey-pokey for us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, no. Look, let me say my story all the way through, and then you can say yours, and then we’ll pick.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Go on.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay. We got tattoos, and then the four girls took us to their place.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But we don’t have tattoos. What if someone asks to see our tattoos?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We say they’re in a very intimate area.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, we are bad boys, aren’t we?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Right, right, so we go back to their place, and then the six of us end up in a hot tub.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But we just got tattoos. Wouldn’t we be concerned about bacterial infection?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: True. Okay, forget the hot tub. The point is, we each have a ménage with sexy goth girls.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow. What a great night.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. Hey, want to try a country bar tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe we’ll get lucky with some sexy cowgirls.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Could happen.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I wonder how they smell.
